intro: Capsicum anomalum, commonly known as the wild pepper or the mountain pepper, is a species native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and tobacco. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are yellow or white, and the fruit is a small, elongated berry that turns red when mature. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, and it is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
